DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study enroll approximately 450 subject see behavioral weight management program successful help military female personnel pregnant post-partum manage weight pregnancy .
DOC.brief_title: Gestational Weight Gain Postpartum Weight Loss Active Duty Women ( Moms Fit 2 Fight )
DOC.detailed_description: Investigators randomize 450 consent participant 1 3 intervention : ) gestational weight gain intervention ( GWG-only ) ; b ) postpartum weight loss intervention ( PPWL-only ) , c ) combine gestational weight gain postpartum weight loss intervention ( GWG+PPWL ) determine efficacy intervention GWG well PPWL . Procedures : Interested individual direct call study telephone number learn determine whether eligibility criterion meet . Individuals meet telephone screen eligibility criterion invite schedule Screening Visit , write informed consent obtain . At visit , eligibility assess measure administrate . The potential participant also ask complete one-week dietary exercise self-monitoring run-in receive medical clearance obstetrician participate . Should continue interested , return Baseline Visit randomize . Randomized participant 5 person schedule visit Screening Visit Baseline Visit Wilford Hall Ambulatory Surgical Center ( WHASC ) San Antonio Military Medical Center ( SAMMC ) Obstetrics ( OB ) clinic . These visit schedule gestational week 32 , 36 , well 6- week , 6-months , 12- month postpartum . At visit , physical measurement collect participant complete various questionnaire .
DOC.criteria: Participants active duty military personnel , station San Antonio area Participants must less 12 week gestation upon recruitment ( base date last menstrual period confirm physician first prenatal visit , typically occur 68 week gestation WHASC SAMMC ) Participants also must within normal , overweight , obese BMI range Must least 1.5 year leave current duty assignment Are generally good health Currently smoking time conception Expecting multiple baby ( e.g . twin ) Diabetic Not interested participate program 21 month
